- Republicans unanimously pick Boehner to be speaker of the House.
Takes over as Speaker of the House from Nancy Pelosi (D-California).
- Wins unopposed re-election to the House.
- Is re-elected Speaker of the House.
The Republican-led House approves a resolution authorizing Boehner to sue President Barack Obama over claims he abused his powers at the expense of Congress and the Constitution.
Initially, he indicated the House would sue over President Obama's decision to delay a central health law requirement for businesses to provide health coverage to their employees.
Runs against Tom Poetter (D); wins with 67% of the vote.
Boehner is elected to a third term as speaker of the House, after a tense floor vote that saw a remarkably large chunk of his own party attempt to remove him.
After accepting a formal invitation from Boehner, Pope Francis speaks to a joint meeting of Congress.
Boehner announces to House Republicans that he is resigning at the end of October.
Boehner gives his farewell remarks on the floor of the US House of Representatives, as he formally retires from his position as House speaker.
It is announced that Boehner has joined the tobacco company Reynolds American as a director.
Announces he is joining the lobbying firm Squire Patton Boggs as an adviser.
Announces he is joining the board of cannabis company Acreage Holdings.
